level.text: 4199.1 When used in this chapter, the following words and phrases shall havehe meanings ascribed:

Best Management Practice (BMP) – Structural or nonstructural practice thatinimizes the impact of stormwater runoff on receiving waterbodies and othernvironmental resources, especially by reducing runoff volume and the pollutantoads carried in that runoff.
Cooling Water – water used as a heat conductor in cooling towers.
DC Water – the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority.
DDOE – the District Department of the Environment.

Non-Potable Water Source – water from a source or sources including, but notimited to, surface water or trucked water, but excluding water from theistrict’s water distribution supply system, groundwater, or cooling water.
